greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Binary weight of A327971: a(n) = A000120(A110240(n) XOR A030101(A110240(n))).
comment: a(n) is the number of times the k-th cell from the left is different from the k-th cell from the right, at the generation n of Rule 30 1-D cellular automaton, when it is started from a single alive cell.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16383
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
example: The evolution of one-dimensional cellular automaton rule 30 proceeds as follows, when started from a single alive (1) cell:

When we count the number of times the k-th cell from the left is different from the k-th cell from the right, we obtain a(n). Note that the central cells (indicated with parentheses) do not affect the count, as the central cell is always equal to itself.
program: \\ Use this one for writing b-files:
A328106write(up_to) = { my(s=1, n=0); for(n=0,up_to, write("b328106.txt", n, " ", hammingweight(bitxor(s, A030101(s)))); s = A269160(s)); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 05 2019
